WRITING.TITLE: $1000-1200AUD for upgrade from laptop.
WRITING.TEXT: gt;**What will you be doing with this PC? Be as specific as possible, and include specific games or programs you will be using.** The usual general gaming, specifically play WoW (Which I have been told is mostly dependent on CPU?) and would like to eventually do some video editing at some point in the future gt;**What is your maximum budget before rebates/shipping/taxes?** Looking for around $1000 AUD ($700USD) but willing to go as high as $1250AUD ($875USD) if you think it will benefit my needs enough. gt;**When do you plan on building/buying the PC? Note: beyond a week or two from today means any build you receive will be out of date when you want to buy.** Not sure, could be within a few days or a few weeks, depends on how good it is. gt;**What, exactly, do you need included in the budget? (Tower/OS/monitor/keyboard/mouse/etc)** everything except monitor, mouse and keyboard gt;**Which country (and state/province) will you be purchasing the parts in? If you're in US, do you have access to a Microcenter location?** Victoria, Australia gt;**If reusing any parts (including monitor(s)/keyboard/mouse/etc), what parts will you be reusing? Brands and models are appreciated.** benq monitor and standard mouse/keyboard gt;**Will you be overclocking? If yes, are you interested in overclocking right away, or down the line? CPU and/or GPU?** Nope gt;**Are there any specific features or items you want/need in the build? (ex: SSD, large amount of storage or a RAID setup, CUDA or OpenCL support, etc)** SSD would be nice but not sure yet if it will be worth my money. gt;**Do you have any specific case preferences (Size like ITX/microATX/mid-tower/full-tower, styles, colors, window or not, LED lighting, etc), or a particular color theme preference for the components?** couldn't care, whatever is cheapest. gt;**Do you need a copy of Windows included in the budget? If you do need one included, do you have a preference?** windows 8 or 10 gt;**Extra info or particulars:** I currently have a laptop that I am looking to upgrade from and would love it if you could provide some insight as to how much of an upgrade the build you are proposing would be over my laptop. laptop has the following: -i5 4210U -8gb ram -2gb intel HD family graphics Thanks for your time!

Thanks a ton for the build and comparison! It looks pretty much just what I was looking for and its nice to have the general idea of performance in WoW aswell. Just had two questions, first off, what graphic settings where those framerates based off of? and also I have heard that 16gb ram can be overkill, rather not spend the money if I don't have to. Is the 16gb a reccomendation based on budget or based on what I am going to be using the computer for? Thanks again for the build!
Perfect, thanks for your time.

So I was doing a random daily heroic dungeon for valor and garrison resources and get put into an UBRS group. Notably among the group were a fresh shadow priest and a decently geared warrior tank. The second we get into the dungeon the priest kindly asks "Does anyone mind if we do leeroy?" (not an exact quote, but it was definitely said in a nice way). I along with what I thought was all the group agree as it doesn't take long to do and followers are annoying to get at first. Fast forward to the first the jump down to the third boss and we notice we missed a pack in the previous room, the tank jumps down anyway and we are forced to follow him. We bring it up and he links HIS Leeroy follower multiple times and continues. We of course call him out on it, fair enough to not want to the achievement but he was being quite rude. He starts to say things like "Don't do it in the first daily heroic" and the usual "u mad?" followed by more leeroy linking and saying he doesn't care hes just here for valor. We get to the final boss, and as the add phase is in progress a "would you like to kick ____" vote box comes up. I quickly double check who it is, sure enough its the tank, so he gets kicked and we finish off the boss, and he gets none of his precious valor. TLDR: Tank was being a dick, got him kicked DURING the last boss of UBRS so he missed out on the valor.

Fair enough, cant remember exactly everything he said but the takeaway is yes, he was making me mad, I already had the follower so didn't really care about that but I can tell you that he definitely deserved it.

WRITING.TITLE: $1500 AUD or less for Wow
WRITING.TEXT: gt;**What will you be doing with this PC? Be as specific as possible, and include specific games or programs you will be using.** Mainly playing wow, would probably play other games with a decent computer. gt;**What is your maximum budget before rebates/shipping/taxes?** $1500 AUD but definitely dont need to spend that much if I can get something cheaper that will run WoW on ultra in a raid environment with good FPS. gt;**When do you plan on building/buying the PC? Note: beyond a week or two from today means any build you receive will be out of date when you want to buy.** Within the week if i find a build im happy with. gt;**What, exactly, do you need included in the budget? (Tower/OS/monitor/keyboard/mouse/etc\)** Just the tower and OS. gt;**Which country (and state/province) will you be purchasing the parts in? If you're in US, do you have access to a Microcenter location?** Victoria, Australia gt;**If reusing any parts (including monitor(s)/keyboard/mouse/etc), what parts will you be reusing? Brands and models are appreciated.** just monitors. gt;**Will you be overclocking? If yes, are you interested in overclocking right away, or down the line? CPU and/or GPU?** no gt;**Are there any specific features or items you want/need in the build? (ex: SSD, large amount of storage or a RAID setup, CUDA or OpenCL support, etc)** small SSD would be nice. gt;**Do you have any specific case preferences (Size like ITX/microATX/mid-tower/full-tower, styles, colors, window or not, LED lighting, etc), or a particular color theme preference for the components?** red I guess, but whatever is cheapest gt;**Do you need a copy of Windows included in the budget? If you do need one included, do you have a preference?** yes, I needs windows.

WRITING.TITLE: Case to prevent pet hair?
WRITING.TEXT: ###Build Help/Ready: **Have you read the sidebar and [rules](http://www.reddit.com/r/buildapc/wiki/rules)? (Please do)** Yep **What is your intended use for this build? The more details the better.** Specifically Playing Wow, but gaming in general as well. **If gaming, what kind of performance are you looking for? (Screen resolution, FPS, game settings)** 1080p 60fps+ on ultra. **What is your budget (ballpark is okay)?** 1200-1400$ AUD **In what country are you purchasing your parts?** Victoria, Australia **Post a draft of your potential build here (specific parts please). [Consider formatting your parts list.](http://www.reddit.com/r/buildapc/wiki/pcpp) Don't ask to be spoonfed a build (read the rules!)**. [PCPartPicker part list](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/list/xLNMZ8) / [Price breakdown by merchant](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/list/xLNMZ8/by_merchant/) Type|Item|Price :----|:----|:---- **CPU** | [Intel Core i5-6500 3.2GHz Quad-Core Processor](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/xwhj4D/intel-cpu-bx80662i56500) | $274.00 @ Centre Com **Motherboard** | [Asus H170-PRO ATX LGA1151 Motherboard](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/qjp323/asus-motherboard-h170pro) | $164.00 @ Umart **Memory** | [G.Skill NT Series 16GB (2 x 8GB) DDR4-2400 Memory](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/kCL7YJ/gskill-memory-f42400c15d16gnt) | $86.90 @ Newegg Australia **Storage** | [A-Data Premier Pro SP900 128GB 2.5" Solid State Drive](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/2dkD4D/a-data-internal-hard-drive-asp900s3128gmc) | $89.00 @ CPL Online **Storage** | [Western Digital Caviar Blue 1TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/MwW9TW/western-digital-internal-hard-drive-wd10ezex) | $68.00 @ CPL Online **Power Supply** | [Corsair CX 500W 80+ Bronze Certified Semi-Modular ATX Power Supply](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/PHCwrH/corsair-power-supply-cx500m) | $99.00 @ Centre Com | *Prices include shipping, taxes, rebates, and discounts* | | **Total** | **$780.90** | Generated by [PCPartPicker](http://pcpartpicker.com) 2016-07-20 16:27 AEST+1000 | **Provide any additional details you wish below.** Im planning on purchasing a GTX1060 if I can find one I like for the right price or an aftermarket RX480 as soon as possible. Where I really need help is with a choice in case, I have a cat and a dog that both shed A LOT, ridiculously a lot. Im assuming a case with very good air filters will help me out in this situation but without any past experience with building computers I don't know where to start looking other then one by one on retailers websites. I don't want to spend any more then $125 AUD on a case and it would be amazing to spend less then $100 but i am not sure how feasible that is. As far as color or style goes i am not too fussy, if it is going to help keep hair out of my computer i am happy. If you have any experience with this or know of any cases that fit my needs please let me know!

WRITING.TITLE: ~$1300 AUD WoW Legion PC
WRITING.TEXT: gt;**What will you be doing with this PC? Be as specific as possible, and include specific games or programs you will be using.** Gaming, specifically World of Warcraft Legion and even more specifically 20man raids. gt;**What is your maximum budget before rebates/shipping/taxes?** around the $1300 dollar ballpark but more like lt;$900 AUD for everything except the graphics card. gt;**When do you plan on building/buying the PC? Note: beyond a week or two from today means any build you receive will be out of date when you want to buy.** Tomorrow, everything except the GPU which I will be buying at a later date. gt;**What, exactly, do you need included in the budget? (Tower/OS/monitor/keyboard/mouse/etc\)** Tower, minus the graphics card. gt;**Which country (and state/province) will you be purchasing the parts in? If you're in US, do you have access to a Microcenter location?** Victoria, Australia gt;**If reusing any parts (including monitor(s)/keyboard/mouse/etc), what parts will you be reusing? Brands and models are appreciated.** Will be purchasing an aftermarket rx480 or gtx1060 within a month. Standard razer keyboard, steelseries mouse and a 24.5" 1080p 60Hz monitor. gt;**Will you be overclocking? If yes, are you interested in overclocking right away, or down the line? CPU and/or GPU?** Slightly interested in overclocking down the line, but I dont think its in my budget at the moment so, no. gt;**Are there any specific features or items you want/need in the build? (ex: SSD, large amount of storage or a RAID setup, CUDA or OpenCL support, etc)** a SSD would be great, 128gb is all I need though. gt;**Do you have any specific case preferences (Size like ITX/microATX/mid-tower/full-tower, styles, colors, window or not, LED lighting, etc), or a particular color theme preference for the components?** Mid tower. gt;**Do you need a copy of Windows included in the budget? If you do need one included, do you have a preference?** Nope, I can get a free copy of windows 10 (student? or education? cant remember exactly, is this version going to be ok?) gt;**Extra info or particulars:** I am going to purchase a gtx1060 or rx480 in roughly a months time just before actual legion launch date, so although my total budget is around the $1300 AUD mark I am looking for a build without a gpu for ~$900, preferably less. Depends on what the prices are like then which card I get. I also have a cat and a dog that shed an insane amount, so a case with good filters on any intake fans is an absolute must, other then that i am not too fussed about general appearance of my PC, just how well it runs. Last but not least i'd love to save on shipping, so depending on how hard it is to figure out, $10-$20 priority on parts that I can pick up tomorrow from PC shops around Melbourne. Thanks for your time putting a build together for me, and feel free to ask me if you need any more information/clarification

WRITING.TITLE: Check my first ever PC build for me?
WRITING.TEXT: ###Build Help/Ready: **Have you read the sidebar and [rules](http://www.reddit.com/r/buildapc/wiki/rules)? (Please do)** Yes. **What is your intended use for this build? The more details the better.** General gaming, but in specific WoW: Legion, and even more specifically raiding. **If gaming, what kind of performance are you looking for? (Screen resolution, FPS, game settings)** 1080p, 60fps, Ultra **What is your budget (ballpark is okay)?** ~$1300 AUD **In what country are you purchasing your parts?** Victoria, Australia **Post a draft of your potential build here (specific parts please). [Consider formatting your parts list.](http://www.reddit.com/r/buildapc/wiki/pcpp) Don't ask to be spoonfed a build (read the rules!)**. [PCPartPicker part list](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/list/ZLN3bj) / [Price breakdown by merchant](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/list/ZLN3bj/by_merchant/) Type|Item|Price :----|:----|:---- **CPU** | [Intel Core i5-6500 3.2GHz Quad-Core Processor](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/xwhj4D/intel-cpu-bx80662i56500) | $274.00 **Motherboard** | [Asus H170-PRO ATX LGA1151 Motherboard](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/qjp323/asus-motherboard-h170pro) | $164.00 **Memory** | [Kingston FURY 16GB (2 x 8GB) DDR4-2400 Memory](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/nq38TW/kingston-memory-hx424c15fbk216) | $99.00 **Storage** | [Western Digital Caviar Blue 1TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/MwW9TW/western-digital-internal-hard-drive-wd10ezex) | $68.00 **Case** | [Corsair SPEC-01 RED ATX Mid Tower Case](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/pDphP6/corsair-case-spec01redled) | $75.00 **Power Supply** | [Corsair CX 500W 80+ Bronze Certified Semi-Modular ATX Power Supply](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/PHCwrH/corsair-power-supply-cx500m) | $84.00 **Monitor** | [BenQ GL2450HM 24.0" 60Hz Monitor](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/4XxfrH/benq-monitor-gl2450hm) | Purchased For $0.00 **Other**| Kingston UV400 128gb SSD| $49.00 **Other**| Windows 10 Education| $0.00 | *Prices include shipping, taxes, rebates, and discounts* | | **Total** | **$813.00** | Generated by [PCPartPicker](http://pcpartpicker.com) 2016-07-21 22:22 AEST+1000 | **Provide any additional details you wish below.** I am planning on buying a aftermarket gtx1060/rx480 in roughly 1 month and am happy to deal with integrated graphics until then. All parts are going to be purchased from MSY, which for some reason is not listed on pcpartpicker as a retailer. Have checked each individual price against pcpartpicker, and MSY is cheaper then all of them apart from the RAM which isn't worth me driving to a different store for just ~$5. Planning on buying all the listed parts tomorrow and would like the thumbs up from someone experienced with building computers before I make the plunge. Also, I can get windows 10 "Education" through my university for free, is this version of windows going to work for me? are there any major downsides to it? Thanks for your time looking over my build, I really appreciate it :D

Thanks a ton for the reply, Have an SSD in there, but for some reason it wasn't listed on PCPartPicker so I had to custom add it, its only 128gb but I'm more then happy just putting my OS and WoW on it. As far as PSU's go the listed PSU was really my best guess, should I be looking for something like gold rating or more watts? Thanks again

WRITING.TITLE: Am I all good to go with this system?
WRITING.TEXT: ###Build Help/Ready: **Have you read the sidebar and [rules](http://www.reddit.com/r/buildapc/wiki/rules)? (Please do)** yes **What is your intended use for this build? The more details the better.** Gaming, more specifcally WoW: Legion and even more specifically raiding. **If gaming, what kind of performance are you looking for? (Screen resolution, FPS, game settings)** 1080p, 60fps+, ultra **What is your budget (ballpark is okay)?** $1300AUD, that price includes the graphics card that I will purchase seperately in the coming weeks though. **In what country are you purchasing your parts?** Victoria, Australia **Post a draft of your potential build here (specific parts please). [Consider formatting your parts list.](http://www.reddit.com/r/buildapc/wiki/pcpp) Don't ask to be spoonfed a build (read the rules!)**. [PCPartPicker part list](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/list/rsqskT) / [Price breakdown by merchant](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/list/rsqskT/by_merchant/) Type|Item|Price :----|:----|:---- **CPU** | [Intel Core i5-6500 3.2GHz Quad-Core Processor](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/xwhj4D/intel-cpu-bx80662i56500) | $274.00 **Motherboard** | [Asus H110M-A/M.2 Micro ATX LGA1151 Motherboard](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/jY98TW/asus-h110m-am2-micro-atx-lga1155-motherboard-h110m-am2) | $95.00 **Memory** | [Kingston FURY 16GB (2 x 8GB) DDR4-2400 Memory](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/nq38TW/kingston-memory-hx424c15fbk216) | $99.00 **Storage** | [Western Digital Caviar Blue 1TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/MwW9TW/western-digital-internal-hard-drive-wd10ezex) | $68.00 **Storage**| Kingston UV400 240gb SSD| $79.00 **Case** | [Corsair SPEC-01 RED ATX Mid Tower Case](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/pDphP6/corsair-case-spec01redled) | $75.00 **Power Supply** | [Corsair CXM 550W 80+ Bronze Certified Semi-Modular ATX Power Supply](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/3hkwrH/corsair-power-supply-cp9020102na) | $95.00 **Monitor** | [BenQ GL2450HM 24.0" 60Hz Monitor](http://au.pcpartpicker.com/product/4XxfrH/benq-monitor-gl2450hm) | Purchased For $0.00 **Operating System**| Windows 10 Education| $0.00 | *Prices include shipping, taxes, rebates, and discounts* | | **Total** | **$785.00** | Generated by [PCPartPicker](http://pcpartpicker.com) 2016-07-24 17:48 AEST+1000 | **Provide any additional details you wish below.** All parts are going to be purchased from MSY as conveniently they had the lowest price for every part except for RAM, which was marginally more expensive then the next best. I am going to be purchasing an AiB 1060 or 480 in the coming weeks when stock stabilizes and all the option are out. This is my first build so I'm just looking for the OK from some experienced builders/people who know what they are talking about. I noticed the motherboard said it only supports upto 2133MHz RAM, is this something I should be worried about or is it standard and the performance effect minimal? Last but not least i'm happy with the case but still not 100% sold on it, if you have any experience with a case that is less than $100 AUD and has removable air filters on all intakes most importantly, and 2 fans, let me know. I was very excited by the Antec P280 MSY had on clearance for $90 but unfortunately the last one sold. Thanks a ton for your time
Mages get a portal to their class hall too.

This is far from true, taking Mage as an example, one trait can be worth up to 15 relic ilvls more then another. As for finding out which ones are better you'd have to find a guide online if there is one for your class or use sim craft to check yourself.

Got to 8010 rep last night. Definitely didn't use any bugs, just optimal scenario runs, getting 110 very early and completing ley line feeds and unlocking the extra world quests early. It's a snowball effect, the faster you got honoured the sooner you got more world quests. The darkmoon fair buff really helped too.
It's not bad, it can be viable as long as you don't mind not being optimal. That being said fire is currently better in pretty much every situation.
4, 1 for "free" where I didn't get max rep then the next three I got the maximum 425 rep

The Gul'dan fight will have something like this, you do increased damage but the buff is suppressed if you take fire damage. Afaik some of the fire damage mechanics NEED to be taken as well so it's slightly different.
http://imgur.com/a/PE2bg Fire mages know that feel
You realise they don't release patch notes for PTR right? The MMO "patch notes" are made from data mining.

They said they were going to do something like this at blizzcon. And is testing something in the ptr not enough notice for you? Would you prefer they give you 2 weeks notice prior to testing something on a test realm that they don't release patch notes for in the first place?
And why should a guild give loot to someone who may or may not be around after 2 weeks anyway? What's wrong rewarding those who are consistent and most likely to stick around?
Since 7.1 it actually is true. It's still possible that 3 chests increases the chance, who knows. but legendaries definitely can now only be contained in the "AP chest"
Warcraft logs currently is ignoring skorpyron when calculating aggregate and all star points for that very reason
Method.gg/raidprogress is being updated by the same guy who used to do manaflask

That's not how simcraft works... it is more then capable of simming random proc trinkets. Sure, in the 10000 iterations it goes through one might have it Proc with cooldowns every time, but another it might not proc at all.
There is an addon that I use to do the opposite, filter out US servers. I'm pretty sure it's called "localised groups" and should work for you too

WRITING.TITLE: How to save a Mythic Avatar wipe

WRITING.TEXT: wasn't a first kill or anything but that was the kill for the week, yah.

Basically if those green swirls you see arnt soaked they destroy the platform and deal large raid wide damage, likely killing multiple people or straight up wiping the raid. Luckily for me they drop in a slightly staggered sweeping fashion across the platform, allowing me to soak one and then blink into a second saving the raid. According to my death log there was .35 seconds between the first meteor landing and the second.
Weak aura to more easily show stacks of fingers of frost

WRITING.TITLE: Extremely rough/messy bottom layer
WRITING.TEXT: I recently got a cr-10 and after some tweaking/testing am mostly happy with the print quality. However the bottom layer of my prints is in my opinion beyond bad. I am printing with a raft for most things right now until my pei sheet arrives. I have done some smaller prints without a raft and it is smoother but still quite messy/full of gaps and clear lines. The rest of the print is fine, except the top surface which is MUCH better but still not where I want It to be. I #8217;m using an Australian brand pla+ filament https://imgur.com/a/PJCIv

WRITING.TITLE: Ideas for who to get to review my SoP?
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m applying for some aerospace engineering masters programs at American universities, however I got my bachelors in Australia and currently reside here. This also means that my LoR writers are Australian, and don #8217;t have much/any experience with the American graduate admissions process. I am working with them to write good LoRs, providing resources and samples ect, but I #8217;m especially concerned with getting feedback on my SoP. They will likely be able to provide generic feedback, but obviously they lack the experience of the do #8217;s and do not #8217;s. Has anyone got any recommendations on where I can look to get solid feedback?

I believe it #8217;s B. For them to be equal, x and y would have to be along the same line, and the diagram clearly shows they are not, and if they were, that would necessarily be represented by a different diagram.

It does state though that while diagrams aren #8217;t necessarily to scale, relative position can still be assumed from diagrams, and the diagram pretty clearly shows that the line x isn #8217;t continuous with the line y. Another way of looking at it is that there is definitely a line segment horizontally connecting the vertical lines of x and y, so they are not continuous.
Not through ETS, but I have seen some programs say they will look at your best scores for each section.
